name: code
description: Used in conjunction with looping / branching options to execute multiple statements within a single block of a loop or branch

name: count
description: executes a statement for a specified number of times, storing the number of the current iteration in a variable called roll.count.

num.description: The number of loops to perform

name: dialog
description: Opens a dialog window.

dialogName.description: The unique name of the dialog window.

config.description: A semicolon separated String Property List to config the dialog.

name: dialog5
description: Opens a dialog window supporting HTML5.

dialogName.description: The unique name of the dialog window.

config.description: A semicolon separated String Property List to config the dialog.

name: expanded
description: Evaluates the text after the ':' and displays the detailed output of the evaluation.

name: for
description: Executes a statement for a number of iterations based on a start and end value.

start.description: The number to start counting from.

end.description: The at wich the loop will stop executing. Does not execute when var reaces end.

stepsize.description: Integer greater than zero to increment `var` by each step.

separator.description: Output between each execution of the loop.

name: foreach
description: Iterates over the contents of a string list.

var.description: The variable which will hold the value of the list item each iteration.

list.description: The object to iterate through. Note for JSON Objects, only iterats over the keys.

output_separator.description: Output between each execution of the loop.

list_separator.description: Separator of input list. Not needed for JSON Arrays/Objects

name: frame
description: Opens a dockable frame window supporting HTML3.2.

frameName.description: The unique name of the frame window.

config.description: A semicolon separated String Property List to config the frame.

name: frame5
description: Opens a dockable frame window supporting HTML5.

frameName.description: The unique name of the frame window.

config.description: A semicolon separated String Property List to config the frame.

name: g
description: Evaluates the text after the ':' but only displays the results to the gm.

name: gt
description: Evaluates the text after the ':' and will display the result to everyone, but only displays the tooltip to the GM.

name: hidden
description: Evaluates the text after the ':' but completely discards the output.

name: if
description: Branches the flow of the roll as determined by the condition.

condition.description: The condition/s to check to determine which roll (`true_body` or `false_body`) is executed, if any. The condition/s can only contain one level of nested parenthesis.

notes: `true_body` follows the colon `:` after the roll options. `false_body` (if any) must follow a semi-colon `;` after `true_body`.

name: macro
description: Runs the named macro, returning its output in the form of the macro.return special variable.

macro_ref.description: A string in the form `macro_name@location` where location can be one of: 'TOKEN', 'campaign', 'global', 'Lib:*', or 'this'

name: overlay
description: Places a transparent HTML5 overlay over the map view.

overlayName.description: The unique name of the overlay window.

zorder.description: An integer representing the order the overlays will be painted (low to high).

name: result
description: Evaluates the text after the ':' and displays the plain output without any formatting or tool tips

name: s
description: Evaluates the text after the ':' but only displays the results to yourself.

name: st
description: Evaluates the text after the ':' and will display the result to everyone, but only displays the tooltip to yourself.

name: switch
description: Chooses among several options and executes code based on the expression.

expression.description: The *regular expression* that determines which case is executed.

name: tooltip
description: Evaluates the body of the roll (the text after the ':' ) and displays the evaluation steps (like the expanded roll option) in a tool-tip attached to the string argument. Where no string argument is provided the tool-tip is attached to the result of the roll.

name: token
description: Executes the code after the ':' as if the specified token was the context.

identifier.description: The name of the token who's context to use.

name: unformatted
description: Evaluates the text after the ':' and displays the detailed output without coloring or tool tips.

name: w
description: Evaluates the text after the ':' but only displays the results to the specific named user,

name.description: The names of the users to show the output to.

name: while
description: Repeatedly executes a statement until a condition becomes false.

separator.description: Output between each execution of the loop.
